item.title: Report E-2024110484
item.description:
Report E-2024110484

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-27T12:24:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-22
  • City: SHREVEPORT
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On November 22, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1993 was punctured and released five (5) gallons to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from E3 Environmental to remediate the site. The crew overpacked the damaged drum and utilized absorbents to clean the area. All impacted absorbents were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report X-2024110994
item.description:
Report X-2024110994

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-27T12:24:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-07
  • City: Dulles
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=779787375000 PKG TYPE=Package (box/drum/jerrican/composite) PHY STATE=Liquid TRANSPORTATION PHASE=In Transit ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=UN1950 CLASS=21 QTY UOM=Solid - Kilogram PSN TEXT=Aerosol, flammable PKG GRP=N/A SPILLED QTY=0 CONTAINER CAPACITY=0.4 CONTAINER UOM=Solid - Kilogram MATERIAL CONSTRUCTION=A - Metal (any type) NUMBER IN SHIPMENT=1 NUMBER FAILED=1 INNER PKG TYPE=2 - Can TOTAL AMT IN EACH CONTAINER=0.4 TOTAL UOM=Solid - Kilogram )On 11/06/2024 at approximately 2115, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 5028756 at the station location in Dulles, reporting undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment consisted of several bottles of acrylic paint, two bottles of acetone, and a container of spray adhesive, all packaged in a plastic storage bin. The shipment began to display evidence of leakage during loading. Further investigation revealed that the undeclared acetone spilled inside of the tub. While opening the bin to confirm spillage, roughly 84 bottles of acrylic leather paint and a can of spray adhesive was also discovered. The bin did not appear to be prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, missing the required markings. labeling. packaging and paperwork. The shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

item.description:

  • City: GREENCASTLE

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1612 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XHG. It was reported that approximately 1 ounce of Vigil Quat released from a plastic tote due unknown cause. The terminal believes it may just be a loose cap, however due to the corrosive nature the SCM has requested a crew responded for clean-up and further assessment. The release impacted trailer # 5633416. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. The contractor cleaned-up the release using absorbent pads and replaced cap on the tote. One 30-gallon DF containing the impacted absorbent pads and contractor PPE was generated and staged for waste disposal. XPO will manage any waste generated from spill responses.

item.title: Report E-2024110487
item.description:
Report E-2024110487

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-27T12:24:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-31
  • City: ROMULUS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0038 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at XDE. It was reported that approximately 5 gallons of Chem-Trend PU-16224 released from a 330-gallon metal tote due to the valve at the bottom of the tote was opened by unknown cause during the loading process. The release impacted the concrete at dock door 34. The valve has been closed and is no longer leaking and oil dri was placed for containment. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product Chem-Trend released from a 330-gallon metal tote to a 5 x 5 area of the concrete dock floor due to improper loading. Contractors neutralized the area and containerized the impacted absorbents into (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The terminal contained the spill with oil dri. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024110490
item.description:
Report E-2024110490

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-27T12:24:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-18
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 24, 2024, at 1346 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Atlanta, GA regarding the release of Greasestrip Plus (Sodium Hydroxide Solution). Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 2 cups of Greasestrip Plus (UN1824, 8, II) from (1) 1-gallon container onto the trailer floor. The release was reportedly due to products rubbing together and creating a leak, impacting a 4 x 4 area in the trailer. No drains or waterways were impacted by the release. The release was neutralized then cleaned up with absorbents and the proper PPE. Recovered product was re-palletized for the client per clients instruction. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (1) 55-gallon DF, which was then taken offsite by the contractor for proper disposal.

Upon the contractors arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted various cardboard packages inside the trailer and estimated that one (1) quart of material was released due inadequate preparation for transit. Young's Environmental personnel placed the impacted cardboard, shrink-wrap, absorbent pads and PPE into one (1) one 55-gallon poly drum and the damaged plastic jug was placed into one (1) 30-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: At 1641 ET, LSL notified ERTS of a cargo release in St. Louis, MO. It was reported that approximately half a cup of potassium permanganate released from 10-gallon poly drum due to improper loading. The release impacted inside trailer#ITSB5622. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5 cups of Organic Superior Quality Permanganate product released from lids of (6) 10-gallon poly drums. Contractors wiped the lids where leaking occurred with absorbent rags and placed them into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024110901
item.description:
Report X-2024110901

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-25T12:24:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-21
  • City: SAN JOSE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipment was discovered leaking when it was inadvertently placed on its side. The outer box did not have any markings or labels, but the inner box revealed a concealed UN 4G Box of UN 3265, Class 8, PGIII. Inner contents of the UN4G box are 2 plastic bottles @ 2.5 gallons each. 1 bottle was leaking from the cap/top. The labels on the plastic bottles are Ethephon Plant Growth Regulator. The UN4G box was surrounded by empty boxes used as dunnage. The boxes with the Lithium Battery Labels are empty. All of the contents were placed in a salvage drum and held for FAA investigation.

item.title: Report E-2024110456
item.description:
Report E-2024110456

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-25T12:24:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-21
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal BNA experienced a UN2810 Allyl Amyl Glycolate release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2 ounces of product released to a 1 x 1 area of the drum lid due to a loose bung cap. The drum was wiped down, the cap secured and tightened, and a slosh test conducted to ensure no further leaking would occur in transit. The impacted pads and PPE were collected and containerized into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: On November 20, 2024, three (3) 75-pound pails of UN3077 were crushed and released approximately 25-pounds of product to the trailer interior and adjacent items. R+L retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the site. FCE personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remove all released product. All impacted materials and the pails were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024110861
item.description:
Report X-2024110861

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-25T12:24:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-20
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KY, RESPONDED TO A LEAKING AIR DANGEROUS GOODS PACKAGE THAT WAS MARKED AND LABELED AS PAINT, UN1263 WITH A CLASS 3 DIAMOND LABEL, OVERPACK, AND SHIPPERS DECLARATION. THE DANGEROUS GOODS PACKAGE HAD PREVIOUSLY PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN FACILITY. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED THREE INNER BOXES EACH CONTAINING ONE GALLON JUGS OF POLYURETHANE (METH) ACRYLATE RESIN BLEND WITH ONE LEAKING DUE TO A SMALL PUNCTURED AREA AT THE LEFT BOTTOM CORNER OF THE CONTAINER. THE OTHER TWO CONTAINERS WERE NOT LEAKING BUT THE BOTTOM INNER PACKAGING WAS CONTAMINATED.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-25T12:24:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-18
  • City: Savannah
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: NORFOLK SOUTHERN CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During normal switching operations, yard crew reported seeing a liquid running down the side of UTLX 205315 originating around the manway. A response contractor was called to investigate the leak and repair the car. The contractor found the manway swing bolts were less than tool tight with most being able to be turned by hand. The contractor opened the manway and inspected the manway lid gasket and found it in acceptable condition. The manway was closed and properly secured in a tool tight condition. The other service fittings were inspected with no other exceptions noted.

item.title: Report I-2024110060
item.description:
Report I-2024110060

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-25T12:24:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-15
  • City: HONOLULU
  • State: HI
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AEKO KULA DBA ALOHA AIR CARGO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On Friday, 11/15/2024, a shipper attempted to ship undeclared dangerous goods. The shipper, Onesource Distributors, attempted to ship the same product twice on the same day. He went to two different employees and the shipment was rejected each time. Attempt#1 Shipper arrived at approx. 0912 carrying two boxes with limited quantity labels. Our Crew Chief noticed the label and questioned the shipper. Our employee looked up the SDS sheet online, seen it was a dangerous goods product and rejected the shipment. Attempt#2 The same driver came back at approximately 1403 with a different package. Our Cargo Agent helped him and created the air waybill to accept the shipment. However, our Crew Chief who handled the first attempt noticed the same driver. She had the accepting CargoAgent open the package to inspect it and found that it was the same product however it was not in the original package. The shipper took everything out of the original packages and put it in one different package. The shipment was then rejected again. It was also noted that there was no DG placard displayed on the vehicle this product was transported in by highway. Pictures and screenshots will be submitted.

All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 15-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN COLOGNE, GERMANY, ONE PACKAGE FROM USA TO GHANA WAS INSPECTED TO FIND TWO BOTTLES OF FLAMMABLE PERFUMES INSIDE. THE OUTER BOX DOES NOT HAVE ANY DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS. THERMAL TRACKING LABEL AND INVOICE DESCRIBE CONTENTS AS SANDALS. CONTENT INSPECTION REVEALS ONE LEAP FROG TOY, 3.4 OZ BOTTLE OF KENNETH COLE VINTAGE BLACK, AND 3.4 OZ BOTTLE OF VERSACE DYLAN BLUE. BOTH PERFUMES HAVE FLAMMABLE PICTOGRAMS WITH ALCOHOL DENATURED AS AN INGREDIENT ON THEIR RESPECTIVE PERFUME PACKAGING.

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-25T12:24:10+00:00

  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On a routine transfer operation, two Veolia employees were in the process of transferring general solvent waste from the tanker into a rail car. During this procedure, one of the employees, who was relatively new to the department and task, attempted to collect a sample by disconnecting the hose from the tanker's bottom valve. As the employee unfastened one of the camlock's dog ears, the hose suddenly detached, resulting in an unexpected release of approximately 60 gallons of material. Fortunately, the spill was contained within the designated secondary containment area, which consisted of a concrete pad surrounded by a protective berm. The employee who had been disconnecting the hose was directly exposed to the liquid. Following safety protocols, they immediately utilized the nearby safety shower to decontaminate. Meanwhile, the second employee promptly shut off the external valve on the tanker to halt the flow of liquid and then notified the Environmental Health and Safety (EHS) department about the incident.

  • Description: On November 14, 2024, six (6) 2.5-liter jars of hydrochloric acid arrived to the terminal damaged and released approximately 1.25-liters of product to the trailer interior and adjacent cargo. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed a neutralizing agent to the impacted areas. Once neutralization was confirmed with pH strips, absorbent pads were utilized to remove any residual product. The damaged jars, and cardboard box were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal. All spent absorbents, pads and PPE were collected and containerized into one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024110464
item.description:
Report E-2024110464

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-25T12:24:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-07
  • City: SOUTHFIELD
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A spill occurred when a Veolia employee was moving drums for transportation at a customer's site. While using the customer's drum cart, the employee noticed that the cart's feet were not fully positioned beneath the drum being moved. Recognizing the potential hazard, the employee halted the operation and attempted to properly secure the drum onto the cart. Unfortunately, during this adjustment, the cart suddenly slipped away from the drum, causing it to fall. The drum's impact with the metal feet of the cart resulted in a puncture near its top section. Reacting swiftly, the employee rotated the drum to minimize further liquid leakage. To contain the situation, the damaged drum was promptly overpacked on the customer's premises. Following this precautionary measure, the drum was successfully shipped without any additional complications.

item.title: Report E-2024110462
item.description:
Report E-2024110462

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-25T12:24:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-29
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 29, 2024, at 1513 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Albuquerque, NM regarding the release of corrosive fryer & grill cleaner. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 1 cup of Keystone Fryer & Grill Cleaner (UN1824, 8, II) from (1) 1-gallon jug into the carboard box that it was contained in. The release was reportedly due to a load shift, impacting the carboard along with other jugs of product in the box. No drains or waterways were impacted by the release. The release was cleaned up with the proper PPE. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (1) 5-gallon DF, which was then taken offsite by the contractor for proper disposal. All salvaged product was packaged in (1) 55-gallon DM and kept by the client per instruction.

It was reported that approximately 1 gallon of Eco Lab Aqua Balance Muriatic Acid released from (1) 1-gallon plastic jug due to improper loading (terminal USB responsible). The release impacted the trailer floor and box it was shipped in. Terminal personnel already put kitty litter around it and cleared the trailer due to strong odor. Due to product being a corrosive Class 8 and strong smell, ERTS advised a contractor should perform cleanup. Service Center Manager, Lee Jackson, approved terminal personnel to clean the release themselves. Waste was put in (1) 20-gallon poly drum with cardboard, spent oil dri and PPE>

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-25T12:24:10+00:00

  • City: AVON
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 2500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 24th, 2024, at 1818, personnel at the CSXT Avon, Indiana Yard reported a strong odor in the area TILX301735, a residue tank car of Liquefied Petroleum Gas. The car was isolated and the shipper, DK Trading and Supply/Cenovus, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report #2024-1024-00183). HEPACO, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the car leaking from both liquid line valves and the vapor valve. The cause of the releases was all valves being found partially open and secondary closures not secured tool tight. Contractor personnel closed all valves, inspected and installed all secondary closures properly. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shippers representative- Stacy Myers (567-901-1941).

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-25T12:24:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-04
  • City: AVON
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 2000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 10/04/2024, at 2007 hours, personnel at the CSXT Avon, Indiana Yard discovered RDRX 300969, a covered hopper car load of Hazardous Waste, Solid, NOS, leaking from a bottom unloading valve. The car was isolated and the shipper, Blanchard Refining, was of the incident. HEPACO, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found liquid leaking at the threaded connected between the bottom unloading piping and the unloading valve of the hopper car. Contractor personnel tightened the connection between the valve and the cars piping which stopped the release. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shippers representative- Jennifer Johnson (209-986-1196). Following securement of the release the car was released.

  • Description: At 1246 EST on Tuesday, September 24, 2024, a report was made to the Whitewater Township Fire Department of a railcar off-gassing with a spray paint-like odor. The reported railcar, PROX 24041, was documented to contain Styrene Monomer and was located at a railyard near Cleves, OH (39.171181 , -84.763446). The railcar was staged in the Central Railroad of Indiana Cleves Yard. The Whitewater Township Fire Department arrived on site around 1314 to begin cooling efforts. CTEH, SPSI, GHD, HEPACO, Enviro-Serve, and EnviroScience were mobilized to' perform emergency response services. On 9/26/2024 at 1927 EST the evacuation order for Whitewater Township was lifted. 5x(5+1+0)x(5+4) = NARRI 270

  • Description: According to the information obtained, the following occurred. A leak was detected beneath pallet, while staged at the STG Logistics facility, pending transit. Upon inspection, it appeared to have been struck by a forklift. Area was secured, and Environmental Restoration was dispatched to perform the cleanup. Upon arrival on site, ERLLC detected one 5 gallon metal drum had been punctured. Approximately 3 gallons of free product were released to the pallet, and warehouse floor. ERLLC utilized absorbent material on the warehouse floor, and containerized the spent absorbent, debris, and leaking drum into one 55-gallon recovery drum. There were no injuries or exposures reported

  • Description: According to the information obtained, the following occurred. A leak was detected beneath pallet, while staged at the STG Logistics facility, pending transit. Upon inspection, it appeared to have been struck by a forklift. Area was secured, and Environmental Restoration was dispatched to perform the cleanup. Upon arrival on site, ERLLC sorted the pallet to detect the leakers. Approximately 3 gallons of free product were released to the pallet, cardboard, and facility floor. ERLLC sorted freight, overpacked 22 contaminated cardboard cartons and damaged bottles into 3 55-gallon drums, along with spent absorbent material utilized on the facility floor, and recovered all free product. There were no injuries or exposures reported

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NMP experienced a UN2924 PQ-8 release from a 270-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 150-gallons of product released to a 53 x 8 area of the trailer floor and an 80 x 40 area of the asphalt lot below due to a forklift puncture to the tote. A vac truck was dispatched which transferred the material from the damaged tote into a new one. The vac truck was then utilized to collect all free-standing liquid. Sodium bicarbonate and absorbents were then deployed and worked into the impacted areas to clean and neutralize the impacted areas. One 55-gallon poly drum of recovered liquid product was generated. Crew then generated (10) 55-gallon poly drums of impacted absorbents, boom, PPE, and the empty damaged cut up poly tote. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to a 4 x 4 area of the trailer floor and a 4 x 4 area of the concrete dock. The drum was damaged due to rubbing against other freight or the trailer wall and was patched with tape prior to the contractors arrival. The damaged drum was placed into an 85-gallon poly overpack. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. All impacted absorbents and cleanup debris were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-22T12:30:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-08
  • City: WALCOTT
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When driver stopped at the end of his shift and doing the post trip inspection he noticed a little liquid dripping down on the passenger drive tire at approximately 2000ct 11/8/24. The driver then call the company emergency response number and a team was dispatched to the scene. In the meantime the drive put down some absorbent towels on the tire to collect any material that would continue to drip. The team arrived on scene at 2399ct 11/8/2024 and began preparing to enter the trailer. The trailer need to be vented and they were able to make entry at 0200ct 11/9/24 they found that a 30gallon drum had a loose bung. The team tightened the bung and cleaned up the excess material and disposed of them in the appropriate manner. The clean up was complete at 0545ct 11/9/24.

  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately g=four (4) gallons of material released from one (1) 5-gallon plastic jug due to improper handling. The released material impacted the asphalt lot and the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted areas. The spent absorbents were recovered and containerized into one (1) 15-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freights contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024110447
item.description:
Report E-2024110447

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-22T12:30:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-07
  • City: HEBRON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When driver went out to perform his pre trip at the beginning of the day he noticed liquid had dripped onto the drive tire and the pavement at 0530et. The driver put down some absorbent and then called to have a team dispatched to provide the clean up. The crew showed up around 0800et and dawned the proper PPE and made entry into the trailer. They found that a 55 gallon drum had sever rust that had damaged the integrity allowing the material to seep out. The team then removed the container and placed it into a salvage drum and then cleaned up the material that was on the floor of the trailer and that had gotten on the pavement. The absorbents were disposed of in the proper manner. The release was less than 1 gallon and the crew was complete by 1100et.

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Union Pacific Railroad
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 350000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: UTLX 130094, loaded HCL tank car, was reported by the LA City FD to be releasing at an uncontrolled rate from the bottom shell of the car in the 4th St yard in Los Angeles. UPRR Hazmat manager made entry with Los Angeles Fire to apply a mag patch kit. During entry we found a hole in the bottom shell of tank car UTLX 130094 that was caused by a rubber line failure causing HCL to release from the shell of the tank car. A mag seal patch was applied to stop the release.

item.description:
Report E-2024110431

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-22T12:30:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-23
  • City: HUMBLE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 23, 2024, at 1400 ET, Roadrunner Transportation contacted ERTS regarding the release of 5 gallons of Xylene (UN1370, 3, II) from one 5-gallon plastic drum. The release was reportedly due to a load shift and was contained to the trailer floor. A contractor was dispatched to clean up the release using absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste was containerized in (3) 55-gallon plastic drums and (3) 55-gallon metal drums. All waste drums were staged onsite pending proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024110445
item.description:
Report E-2024110445

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-22T12:30:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-17
  • City: LOWELL
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to site. Personnel advised that approximately one (1) gallon of product released impacting a 2x2 area of the trailer floor and cardboard. Personnel advised the release was due to a bad ball valve. Hepaco advised they grounded the poly tote and completed a gravity transfer of the product into a new poly tote. Personnel advised they generated two (2) fifty-five (55) gallon poly drum of waste containing spent absorbent and absorbent pads. They also generated one (1) 330-gallon poly tote containing product only. Dayton Freight personnel approved of the work completed. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freights contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.description:

  • City: BESSEMER
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NBM experienced a UN3267 Chem-Aqua 18106 release from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 50-gallons of product released to a 23' x 8' area of the trailer floor and a 15' x 8' area of the concrete lot below. The drum was damaged due to a broken pallet. The impacted areas were cleaned and neutralized with absorbents and collected into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The damaged drum of product was placed into an 85-gallon poly overpack. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-15
  • City: BESSEMER
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NBM experienced a UN1789 Hydrochloric Acid release from a 250-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 cup of product released to an 8 x 4 area of the wood trailer floor due to a loose cap. The cap was secured and the tote was wiped down for continued shipment. The impacted area was then cleaned with soda ash to neutralize the release. All impacted soda ash, PPE, and poly sheeting were collected into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-12
  • City: CREST HILL
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately five (5) ounces released into the shrink-wrap from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum containing DT STYPOL 040-4332. Personnel advised the drum sustained a dent in the back due to damage from the trailer wall, which caused a small hole and was the cause of the release. Dayton Freight advised they no surfaces were impacted since release was contained to shrink-wrap. The terminal personnel stated they overpacked the drum and the shrink wrap and generated one (1) 85-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freights contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: On November 12, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1292 was punctured and released approximately 40-gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the site. GES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the Tetraethyl Silicate-impacted trailer and dock and worked them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and the 55-gallon drum of Tetraethyl Silicate was containerized in one (1) 95-gallon over-pack.

Personnel confirmed they completed cleanup and generated one (1) five (5) gallon poly drum of waste containing product and spent Oil Dri absorbent. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freights contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-21T12:39:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-11
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On November 11, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of Dichloromethane was punctured in transit and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement underneath the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from E3 Environmental (E3) to remediate the site. E3 personnel deployed granular absorbents to the Dichloromethane-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and one (1) broken-down impacted pallet were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum, and one (1) 55-gallon drum of Dichloromethane was containerized in one (1) 85-gallon over-pack drum.

  • Description: ON November 11, 2024, four (4) 5-gallon pails of paint were crushed and released approximately three (3) gallons of paint to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the paint impacted site. All impacted materials and the damaged pails were collected and containerized in three (3) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

The label of the plastic container stated the contents were flammable liquid and vapor so the spill agent looked for an SDS it states the product is UN1993. There were no DG markings on the out packaging or paperwork. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and is being held at the loaction.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On NOvember 6, 2024, one (1) tote of paint leaked approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the outside of the tote. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Alpha Omega Training and Compliance (AOTC) to remediate the site. Crews observed paint residue that had hardened on the top of the tote. AOTC crews scraped the paint from the tote utilizing hand tools. AOTC wiped down the area and containerized the paint residue and impacted debris into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.description:

  • City: CAMDEN

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On Tuesday, 10/22/2024 at approximately 11:30 a train crew reported UTLX 202686 leaking from the top of the tank car. UTLX 202686 was a loaded tank car of Acetone from the Advansix Plant in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. Conrail Hazardous Material Manager, Joe Caaccamo was in the yard and responded to inspect the tank car. Upon inspection liquid was visible coming from the breadbox seal number ADVANSIX 074737 was intact on the breadbox. The seal was removed and the liquid line was found in the open position well as the secondary securement plug less than tool tight. Once the valve was placed in the closed position the leak stopped entirely. The secondary securement plug was properly secured and all material was dissipating/evaporating from the tank car. Seal number ULINE 1202402 was placed on the breadbox. The tank car was ppaced to be inspected prior to release pending OTMA the following day with no leak detected on 10/23/2024. Tank car UTLX 202686 is still pending OTMA in the Pavonia Terminal. Jeff Matlack with Advansix (267) 319-6382 was informed of the situation and advised OTMA is required.

From there we dispatched (2) additional trucks from Granite City IL to remove the contents from the trailer. At appox 0500 on Oct 22nd all ammonia was removed from the leaking trailer. The trailer was then transported to our maintenance vendor. They entered the tank and saw that a baffle had broken inside the tank and rested against the PRV and bending it causing it leak.

  • Description: On 10/9/2024 at around 12:00, CPKC Hazmat was made aware by FRA Inspector Vincent Leishman that NATX 37675 had been found Ieaking from the bottom outlet valve secondary closure cap during a hazmat inspection. CPKC mobilized a railroad qualified response contractor to investigate and mitigate the release. Upon arrival, responders actuated the bottom outlet valve in an attempt to secure it prior to removing the bottom outlet valve(BOV) cap. While removing the BOV cap, responders discovered that it was less than tool tight. Additionally, responders noticed that Methanol was Ieaking past the bottom outlet ball and seal. A new gasket was installed in the BOV cap. The BOV cap was then secured tool tight, stopping the release. File Note: Item 19-the quantity released was estimated based on the best information available at the time of filing. This shipment was offered as a'bulk' shipment, aka one car load, therefore the exact amount offered in this package is not known to the carrier. This carrier does not have access to mass balance data which can exactly quantify this value.

item.title: Report I-2024110038
item.description:
Report I-2024110038

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-21T12:39:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-08
  • City: SAINT PAUL
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOO LINE RAILROAD COMPANY(DBA CANADIAN PACIFIC KANSAS CITY RAILROAD)
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 10/8/2024 at 12:15 PM, CPKC Hazmat became aware that residue SODIUM CHLORATE hopper car, OFOX 60804, was Ieaking while in the ST Paul, MN rail yard. A rail qualified response contractor was mobilized to investigate and mitigate the release. Upon arrival, OFOX 60804 was found to be Ieaking from the A end hopper on the left side at the bottom camlock cap fitting. The A end hopper was found to have less than 1/8 of a compartment of liquid and solid solution. OFOX 60804 was also found to be Ieaking from the B end hopper on the left side where the bottom of the hopper is fastened to the frame of the car. The B end hopper was found with over 1/2 of a compartment of liquid and solid solution. It appeared that the shipper failed to fully unload the hoppers before releasing the car into transportation. Estimated release from the A end hopper is 9 gallons. Estimated release from the B end hopper is 1 gallon. Responders stopped the release from the A end hopper by securing a nitrile glove over the camlock cap fitting and the loading/unloading line with duct tape and a tension strap. Containment was placed under the point of release emanating from the B end hopper and sealant was applied to the seam where the bottom of the hopper is fastened to the frame of the car to stop the leak. The source of the B end hopper release was.inside the hopper and could not be accessed. The contents of OFOX 60804 were transferred Into a tank truck, and then the hoppers were rinsed with water. The root defect was not determined for the A end bottom camlock cap fitting, though it was thought to have been attributable to a loose component. Likewise, the source of the release on the B end was not determined because it was not visible; however, due to the nature of the commodity moved in this specialized hopper car, it is likely to be attributableto a failure in a weld or seam within the hopper. File Note: Item 19-the quantity released was estimated based on the best info,iation available at the time of filing. This shipment was offered as a'bulk' shipment, aka one car load, therefore the exact amount offered in this package is not known to the carrier. This carrier does not have access to mass balance data which can exactly quantify this value.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately three (3) gallons of product released from one (1) fifty-five (55) gallon poly drum due to a forklift puncture. Personnel advised the release impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel stated that the material was cleaned up using Oil Dri absorbent. Personnel completed cleanup and generated one (1) sixty-five (65) gallon poly drum along with the damaged 55-gallon DM of product. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freights contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: The driver was in the cab of the truck after delivery, when he heard a loud popping noise. He exited the cab to find the generator was on fire. The port authority called the fire department who came to put out the fire. Do to the fire being put out material entered the storm drain adjacent to the site. The cause of the fire could not be determined.
